Detailed Description

Internal interface for handling OBEX protocol events.

Warning;
This is an internal interface which must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

ObexEventHandler is an interface which notifies events which are received by one or more instances of an ObexDispatcher. Each event is notified by invoking an abstract method when an associated ObexDispatcher has received the corresponding message.

This concept avoids message switches and ugly type casts in classes which need to handle OBEX events - they just have to implement this interface by deriving from the abstract class ObexEventHandler.

Additionally, it allows for associating multiple ObexDispatcher instances with one ObexEventHandler instance, sharing an event handler (for example an OBEX server) among multiple execution contexts.

Member Function Documentation

virtual BOOLEAN ObexEventHandler::IsValidContext (   )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Tells whether the current context is valid for message processing.

When an OBEX event handler is shared among multiple execution contexts (this means multiple ObexDispatcher instances are associated with one ObexEventHandler instance), this method should be implemented to return 'TRUE' in the context where processing and notification of OBEX events is appropriate, 'FALSE' otherwise.

In the simple case where the event handler is receiving messages from only one execution context, the method may be implemented to always return 'TRUE'.

Implemented in ObexClientDispatcher, ObexClientOppImpl, ObexServerDispatcher, and ObexServerOppImpl.
